did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection containes Washington Theater Club playbills dating from 1965-1971.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Washington Theater Club was formed in 1957 by the Wentworth family. On April 11, 1969, it became the first theater in Washington to win the coveted Margo Jones award for persistence in a continuing program of new play productions. Its accomplishments included the production of ten world premieres, four American premieres, thirty Washington premieres, and the introduction of sixty-four writers new to area audiences. Like other performing arts groups which flourished in the sixties but did not survive the seventies, the Theater Club came to an end in 1974. The Washington Theater Club was noted for its expansion into new areas and dramatic excellence from its modest inception in a 142-seat theater space to its two-house status with more than 9,000 subscribers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: For more information please see the Washington Theatre Club records, http://www.gwu.edu/gelman/spec/ead/ms2061.xml

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection containes fifty five Washington Theater Club programs. The material dates from 1965-1971.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
Jean Anouilh's Romeo and Jeannette, the Birthday Party, the Eccentricities of a Nightingale, Spread Eagle, Ernest in Love and the Typists and the Tiger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
Hughie, Tiny Alice, the Marriage of Mister Mississippi and the Killer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
the Waters of Babylon, Son of Spread Eagle, My Sweet Charlie and Caligula.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
Five Evenings, Green Julia and the Ginham Dog.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
the Lion in Winter, Lock Up Your Daughters and Mr. Tambo, Mr. Bones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
the Indian Wants the Bronx, Odds and Ends, and other Caged Birds and Bread and Butter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
Spread Eagle IV, the Moths and the Decline and Fall of the Entire World as Seen Through the Eyes of Cole Porter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
the Wolves, Adventures in the Skin Trade, Serenading Louie and Oliver Hailey's Continental Divide.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
Exit the King, and Before You Go.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
the Effect of Gamma Rays on Man-in-the-Moon Marigolds, the Last Sweet Days of Isaac, a 5th of Spread Eagle and Little Boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder containes playbills for the following performances. They are listed in chronological order:
the Web and the Rock, Father's Day and Whores, Wars and Tin Pan Alley.
